1. "band gap energies"

These are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph. The band gap energy is a property of a material that refers to the energy difference between the valence band and the conduction band. In the context of photovoltaic cells, the band gap energy of the polymer material used in the cell determines the range of wavelengths of light that the cell can absorb and convert into electrical energy.
